# RESOURCES
:::


## System Setup

Below is the list of software and tools we use in the lab.

**Element**

Element is a secure collaboration and messaging app based on the Matrix protocol. We use it for secure group communication and research discussions.

<https://element.io/>

**Obsidian**

Obsidian is a powerful knowledge base that works on top of a local folder of plain text Markdown files. It is excellent for personal note-taking and organizing research thoughts.

<https://obsidian.md/>

**Zotero**

Zotero is a free, easy-to-use tool to help you collect, organize, cite, and share research. It is essential for managing your bibliography and references.

<https://www.zotero.org/>

**VS Code**

Visual Studio Code is a code editor redefined and optimized for building and debugging modern web and cloud applications. It is our primary editor for coding tasks.

<https://code.visualstudio.com/>

**XODO**

XODO is an all-in-one PDF reader and annotator. It is highly recommended for reading papers and making annotations on tablet devices or desktops.

<https://www.xodo.com/>

**PDFgear**

PDFgear is a free PDF editor and reader that allows you to convert, merge, and edit PDF files with ease.

<https://www.pdfgear.com/>

**OneDrive**

Microsoft OneDrive is used for file hosting and synchronization. We use it to back up important research data and collaborate on documents.

<https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/onedrive/online-cloud-storage>

**Overleaf**

Overleaf is a collaborative cloud-based LaTeX editor used for writing, editing, and publishing scientific documents.

<https://www.overleaf.com/>

**SumatraPDF**

SumatraPDF is a lightweight, free, open-source PDF, CHM, DjVu, EPUB, XPS, and Comic Book reader for Windows. It is very fast and works well with LaTeX workflows.

<https://www.sumatrapdfreader.org/>

**IguanaTex**

IguanaTex is a free LaTeX Add-In for PowerPoint. It allows you to insert LaTeX equations into your PowerPoint slides seamlessly.

<https://www.jonathanleroux.org/software/iguanatex/>

**Anaconda**

Anaconda is a distribution of the Python and R programming languages for scientific computing, aiming to simplify package management and deployment.

<https://www.anaconda.com/>

**GitHub Desktop**

GitHub Desktop focuses on simplifying your workflow. It allows you to interact with GitHub using a GUI instead of the command line.

<https://desktop.github.com/>

**MarkText**

MarkText is a simple and elegant open-source Markdown editor, focused on speed and usability.

<https://www.marktext.cc/>

**ParaView**

ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform data analysis and visualization application. We use it for visualizing large datasets from simulations.

<https://www.paraview.org/>

**Gmsh**

Gmsh is an open-source 3D finite element mesh generator with a built-in CAD engine and post-processor.

<https://gmsh.info/>

**OBS Studio**

OBS Studio is free and open-source software for video recording and live streaming. It is useful for recording tutorials or presentation demos.

<https://obsproject.com/>

**Everything**

Everything is a search engine that locates files and folders by name instantly for Windows. It is an indispensable tool for managing large numbers of files.

<https://www.voidtools.com/>

**7-Zip**

7-Zip is a file archiver with a high compression ratio. It is free software and handles most archive formats.

<https://www.7-zip.org/>

**FFmpeg**

FFmpeg is a complete, cross-platform solution to record, convert, and stream audio and video.

<https://ffmpeg.org/>

**MATLAB**

MATLAB is a proprietary multi-paradigm programming language and numeric computing environment. It is widely used for algorithm development and data analysis.

<https://www.mathworks.com/products/matlab.html>

**MeshLab**

MeshLab is an open-source system for the processing and editing of 3D triangular meshes. It provides a set of tools for editing, cleaning, healing, inspecting, rendering, and converting meshes.

<https://www.meshlab.net/>

**Blender**

Blender is the free and open-source 3D creation suite. It supports the entirety of the 3D pipelineâ€”modeling, rigging, animation, simulation, rendering, compositing, and motion tracking.

<https://www.blender.org/>
